title.narrative: IR 5.1 PREPARATION AUX REPONSES D'URGENC

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 5.1. By the end of 2018, a strategy is developed and validated by governmental and non-governmental stakeholders, and the UNICEF ability to respond to new emergencies in an efficient, responsive, and tailored way is strengthened in order to strengthen national capacities in risk reduction and emergency management., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESSPCR 5: By the end of 2018, the most vulnerable children and their families, crises' victimes, have received timely and effective assistance those in post- crisis situations have benefited from improved and equitable access to social services and peaceful conflict mediation.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 5.1. By the end of 2018, a strategy is developed and validated by governmental and non-governmental stakeholders, and theUNICEF ability to respond to new emergencies in an efficient, responsive, and tailored way is strengthened in order to strengthennational capacities in risk reduction and emergency management.

description.narrative: In collaboration with the Ministry of National Solidarity and Humanitarian Affairs (SGAH) and the Caritas network, UNICEF supported the extension of the early warning and humanitarian surveillance system from 12 provinces in 2018 to 17 provinces (100% of the target) in 2019. During the reporting period, 686 humanitarian alerts were recorded. All nine UNICEF field offices completed their emergency preparedness plans and have at least one staff member trained on EPR (Emergency, Preparedness, and Response). | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: A work plan is established and implemented with the Ministry of Social Affairs and Humanitarian Action.[Un plan de travail est etabli et mis en uvre avec le Ministere des Affaires Sociales et de l'Action Humanitaire.](48778)

Strengthened emergency response capacity in at least seven provinces where RRMP (Reponse Rapide aux Mouvements de PopulationRapid Response to Population Movements) is not implemented.[Capacite de reponse en urgence renforcee dans au moins sept provinces ne beneficiant pas du programme RRMP (Reponse Rapide aux Mouvements de Population).](48779)
